name: places/ChIJ92NSS4FZwokRaQGD0e7lugc
formattedAddress: 88 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 88 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002-2245, USA

originalText.text:
I would give this group 0 stars if I could.  Mr. S.A specifically was very nasty to us.  My roommates and I lived in the same apartment for 3 years.  We had no complaints issued against us, and yet this group did not extend us any courtesies when our heat went out in the middle of winter last year.  Temperatures were below freezing, and we had pets that would be affected while we were at work.  I emailed the group and told them that I had 2 full weeks off from work, and to send someone by to fix the issue.  They did not.  We once again contacted them, and they started sending people over and demanding that we stay home to let them in.  My roommates and I took turns doing this, and multiple times, no one came.  We had to take time off.  After 3 weeks of this (now 2 months without heat), I called 311 and filed a report since this was highly illegal.  I also had to order safe portable heaters for our pets.  Mr. S.A was incredibly nasty through email the entire time and even threatened that if any fines were imposed, they would be added to our rent.  We ended up working with Desery, who was much easier to speak to, but also essentially useless in helping with our issue.  The people that came to "fix" our issue instead turned the heat all the way up, making our coned bill exponentially higher, and we had to send multiple emails to ask for that money off our rent, but they never compensated me for the heaters I had to buy.  By the time we left our building (Past October) the heating was still not fixed.  I have no idea if they'll bother to fix the heat at all, or wait for the next tenant to complain so that they can do the same thing to them.  Every other review has shown a similar level of disrespect and disregard for the tenants.  If you are planning on being in a building "managed" by this company, please be very careful.  The coned bills are much higher here than any other building I've rented from.  (This is the apartment in East Harlem) This office is a joke, and the employees are either nasty, or can't actually help.  I'm genuinely not sure how they still have jobs, but they definitely don't know how to do the ones they have.  Oh and don't bother responding to this review with misinformation.  We left the apartment clean and in good condition (which seems to be their comeback to any negative reviews).

Edit: Mr. S.A "asked" me to remove his full name from this review, thereby refusing to take accountability for his lack of professionalism.

authorAttribution.displayName: No Nombre Primero No Nombre Apellido

originalText.text: I live in a building managed by them but not owned by them. They offer no maintenance services or repair services other than trash pick up and some sidewalk cleaning. I also saw one of the owners fix a front door himself, so I guess that they have no employees? I also keep receiving rent texts from them. Pretty useless "company" if you ask me.

originalText.text: another lot of corrupt, incompetent brokers. lazy, unresponsive… biggest joke in our society is that people like this steal thousands of dollars from tenants just for posting listings. they don’t do any work for you, i’ve tried misrahi a couple times and every time they prove that they are simply: the worst of them

originalText.text: this is the most disrespected i’ve ever felt by a rental company. DESIREE in particular is not only unprofessional and inappropriate but also downright rude and seems to hate doing her job. In my opinion NOT WASTE YOUR TIME on this rude company. There’s plenty of other places to rent from that don’t keep the entire building filthy. I’ve seen so many rats in the entryway area here that i’ve started a count on my twitter. This place is filthy, they will nickel and dime you at every opportunity, and DESIREE is the rudest “professional” i’ve possibly ever dealt with. including a few of MANY photos i have of the filthy common areas and lack of care from management.

originalText.text: Noah Neacsu was an incredibly helpful agent. He listened to what we thought we were looking for and offered to help us find those kinds of apartments, but also recommended showing us an apartment he had in mind. It turned out to be the perfect apartment in an even better area then we were looking in and for the best price possible. He is very responsive, honest, and reliable. Noah made the first apartment rental in NYC a breeze.  I cannot speak for the other Misrahi agents, but Noah Neacsu is a great choice.
